original_text: # 07/01/20 - Minutes of Strip Module Meeting https://indico.cern.ch/event/873749/ ## Watching brief WILL APPEAR IN THIS SPACE FROM NEXT WEEK ONWARDS ## Minutes ### Introduction (Craig) ##### Suggestion for minutes - (Bart) suggestion to use google docs for minutes and allow others to help with minuting - (Phil) the action list is probably the most important part of all of this ##### QC groups - (Tony) should we add a hybrid/module assembly group to the list - (Craig) to be added to this in 3 months or so - powerboard mass tester, module thermal cycling setup, hybrid crate setup ### Hybrid crate status (Ash) - (Craig) should do the same on FMC-DP - bit trickier due to output buffers - (Vitaliy) what is your scope bandwidth (1 GHz) so could make interpretation tricky - (Vitaliy) could try back termination? It’s already there… ### UV LED driver (Craig) - No questions ### DCDC coil order (Carl) - Barrel (Timon) happy to sign-off - (Tony/Craig) Would need to be run passed Uli for BMBF part - (Tony/Craig) Need to run past Didier et al. - can be done along with the passive components - Dennis also says he is happy if Timon is happy - Ulli happy - (Craig) what are the QC steps? Satish answers (Carl/Satish/Timon to write document): - Magnet tests at Yale - Irradiation at BNL - Temperature range at LBL - Solder joint Yale/LBL - Purchasing of components for production - Barrel powerboards - no (preprod first, then production) - Barrel hybrids - no (on 12 month cycle with company) - EC - no - Review office happy for us not to qualify all passives ### AoB - None ## Actions 1. Send around email for volunteers for QC groups and get them going (Craig) 1. Write QC document for coils (Timon/Carl/Satish) 1. Contact review office about coil ordering (Tony A)

original_text: # 14/01/20 - Minutes of Strip Module Meeting https://indico.cern.ch/event/874164/ ## Actions carried over 1. Write QC document for coils (Timon/Carl/Satish) ## Watching brief Item | Responsible | Next update expected HV tab bonding | Jens | 03/02/2020 Hybrid crate roll-out | Ash | 03/02/2020 Module thermal cycling roll-out | Dave/Ankush/Sergio | 03/02/2020 Powerboard mass tester roll-out | Timon/Karol | 03/02/2020 Barrel hybrid tendering | Bart/Ash | 03/02/2020 Barrel powerboard tendering | Carl/Timon | 03/02/2020 EC hybrid/powerboard tendering | Uli/Kambiz/Dennis | 03/02/2020 EC tooling design/roll-out | Marc | 03/02/2020 Barrel tooling design finalisation/roll-out | Sven | 03/02/2020 - People listed as responsible will be contacted periodically by Craig & Ingo for updates (certainly on the date listed, if not before!) - Updates could be verbal, email or slides in a meeting ## ## Minutes ### Introduction (Craig & Ingo) - Anything else than in list on page 2? No comments - Dave: how do I understand a watching brief? - Give regular updates, more focus on those topics than usual - What are QC groups supposed to do? - Look through existing documents, identify open issues, present during ITk week what needs to be tackled next, what status is in general - Need nice instructions for pre-production, QC groups are supposed to bring us closer to a state where we have those - Groups need to comply with documents provided! - Bob volunteers for electrical tests - Start from documents that were written for module FDR ### Site Qualification Survey (Karola) - No questions ### FMC-DP Status (Craig) - Send email to Craig if you need a “multi module to nexys” card (aka FMC-DP) by ITk week or afterwards - Update google doc (linked in slides) for DAQ board counting ### AoB - None ## New Actions 1. Send site quali document email (Karola)

original_text: # 28/01/20 - Minutes of Strip Module Meeting https://indico.cern.ch/event/874219/ ## Actions carried over 1. Write QC document for coils (Timon/Carl/Satish) ## Watching brief Item | Responsible | Next update expected HV tab bonding | Jens | 03/02/2020 Hybrid crate roll-out | Ash | 03/02/2020 Module thermal cycling roll-out | Dave/Ankush/Sergio | 03/02/2020 Powerboard mass tester roll-out | Timon/Karol | 03/02/2020 Barrel hybrid tendering | Bart/Ash | 03/02/2020 Barrel powerboard tendering | Carl/Timon | 03/02/2020 EC hybrid/powerboard tendering | Uli/Kambiz/Dennis | 03/02/2020 EC tooling design/roll-out | Marc | 03/02/2020 Barrel tooling design finalisation/roll-out | Sven | 03/02/2020 - People listed as responsible will be contacted periodically by Craig & Ingo for updates (certainly on the date listed, if not before!) - Updates could be verbal, email or slides in a meeting ## Minutes ### Introduction (Craig & Ingo) - Comment to move weighing and bonding later in the ITk week session to allow maximal US attendance - Will be done ### Shipping box survey (Karola) - Question on whether refers to all the shipping options - Answer, yes ### Prototype HV tab holder (Bart) - Sven not sure length is well defined, Bart to discuss with Tony W - However simple - something like this is useful to save time (Vitaliy) ### Test coupon measurements (Sven) - ASIC lands on test coupons identical to hybrids? - Yes - Metal trace variability should not affect shield layer functionality - Via chain will remain? - Yes - EC using same test coupon? - Kambiz copied the design as far as Sven knows - Dennis will make Kambiz aware of this change proposal ### Mechanical endcap hybrids (Sarah & Kunlin) - Is 0.25mm core ok Dennis? - Should be ok - Won’t know 100% until tender process complete/more developed - Prague would like to order more mechanical hybrids - Order is not yet closed, please fill in google sheet, Karo will add link to sheet to EC planning meeting agenda tomorrow ### UV and polaris epoxy temperature dependence (Jane) - Temperature dependent calibration has been done (RAL) and worked reasonably for UV glue - not tried with Polaris - Stencil might be more reliable, but one has to be somewhat crafty to be able to use it reliably - How to check glue amounts? - Check by weight - Tests for this talk were done for Polaris without hardener ### EC HV tab jig (Dennis & Marc) - Should we move all EC Tabs to 5mm longer? - Better not to avoid knock on effects (e.g. in cold box design etc) and short tab will be produced anyway ### AoB - Forest chimes in with an additional talk about wire bonding - Will be added to the agenda ## Actions 1. Write QC document for coils (Timon/Carl/Satish) 1. Email ITk week presenters and upload to indico (Craig/Ingo)

original_text: # 11/02/20 - Minutes of Strip Module Meeting https://indico.cern.ch/event/874221/ ## Actions carried over NONE ## Watching brief Item | Responsible | Next update expected HV tab bonding | Jens | 27/02/2020 Hybrid crate roll-out | Ash | 02/03/2020 Module thermal cycling roll-out | Dave/Ankush/Sergio | 02/03/2020 Powerboard mass tester roll-out | Timon/Karol | 02/03/2020 Barrel hybrid tendering | Bart/Ash | 17/02/2020 Barrel powerboard tendering | Carl/Timon | 28/02/2020 EC hybrid/powerboard tendering | Uli/Kambiz/Dennis | 17/02/2020 EC tooling design/roll-out | Marc | 02/03/2020 Barrel tooling design finalisation/roll-out | Sven | 29/02/2020 - People listed as responsible will be contacted periodically by Craig & Ingo for updates (certainly on the date listed, if not before!) - Updates could be verbal, email or slides in a meeting ## ## Minutes ### Introduction (Craig & Ingo) - Nothing to report ### DCDC coils (Satish) - Are the QC boundaries acceptable from a powerboard performance point of view? - Satish thinks they are but there doesn’t seem to be any data to back this up - Specs defined more by what is possible with available wire rather than being led by ATLAS performance specs - How many samples will be tested? - 10 samples from each 1/50 of production - 500 coils total - How was the quantity evaluated? - EC 10,000 makes sense after discussion with production management - 16,000 for barrel makes sense to Dennis but looks like overhead is slightly different - The risk of yield numbers changing slightly is why typically PRR is the point that large numbers get bought - it is an understood risk to buy everything now ### Status of powerboard test crate (Christian) - No questions ### Barrel module frame and hybrid panel finalisation (Sven) - Clearance okay on module transport frame for RFID? - Should be okay - If necessary, Craig/Ash will iterate to make sure everything fits together - Can be tricky to keep track of all the diodes when placing the sensor/module in the frame - Worry that moving them in would make them work - Could think about removing them along one side or the other? - Gerrit likes the security of all 4 sides - High voltage connector - Can we change the high voltage to be on a separate connector? - Discussion of pros/cons - Pros = one connector, backward compatability - Cons = custom cable, H&S - Conclude to keep the single connector and look at providing a breakout board to commercial HV options (eg. LEMO) if people prefer that to home-made cables - Mini display port labelling - Labels are provided on the transport frames - silk screen on PCB is hidden by transport frame - Labels to be included on the PCB silk screen in case of running without transport frame in place (not recommended procedure!) ### Barrel transport frame (Gerrit) - Ribbing was added (optimised?) by the injection moulding company - For the next ver

original_text: sion Hongbo will discuss with them to see if we can optimise the ribbing a bit more to improve planarity - Suction cup “hole” dimensions to be updated (mistake by Craig) - Updated versions will be uploaded to EDMS for discussion - Will include discussion of specified suction cups - Assembly of box with threaded back-plane trickier without screw guidance, risk of sensor moving around whilst you are assembling - Craig forgot that when assembling the box the transport frame is already screwed in place!! - Generally seems to make the assembly nicer - Sticking suction cups - Smaller suction cups and correct sized holes do help - Need to investigate the other materials available - From ITk week, don’t clean with isoprop, just DI water, seems isoprop makes surface stickier - How do you use the humidity indicators and dessicant with this box, looks like bag volume and sensor volume connection can be blocked by vacuum sealing - SCIPP looking at side pocket solution - Also N2 flushed sealing rather than vacuum could be an option ### AoB - BPOL v4 vs. v5 (we previously committed to v4 for preproduction but could consider v5 if schedule does not change any more - comment from BCP reviewer) - Craig speaks in support of v4 for reasons of schedule risk and previous commitment - US agrees with commitment to v4 and would keep baseline as v4 with a few v5 (100) for validation, Dennis doesn’t really care but is happy to stick to v4 - We will push back on review to stick with v4 for preproduction - There is risk to coupling preproduction to v5 schedule and we have already committed (deliberately) to v4 ### Actions NONE

From ITk week, don’t clean with isoprop, just DI water, seems isoprop makes surface stickier

There is risk to coupling preproduction to v5 schedule and we have already committed (deliberately) to v4
